Assertion: The degree of a polynomial is always equal to the highest power of the variable.
Reason: The coefficient of the highest power term determines the degree of the polynomial.

options.a: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
options.b: Both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
options.c: Assertion is true but reason is false
options.d: Both assertion and reason are false

question:
Assertion: A quadratic polynomial can have at most two zeroes.
Reason: The graph of a quadratic polynomial is a parabola that can cut the x-axis at most twice.

options.a: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
options.b: Both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
options.c: Assertion is true but reason is false
options.d: Both assertion and reason are false

question:
Assertion: If α and β are zeroes of a quadratic polynomial ax² + bx + c, then α + β = -b/a.
Reason: The sum of zeroes of a quadratic polynomial is always negative.

options.d: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
options.c: Both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
options.b: Assertion is true but reason is false
options.a: Both assertion and reason are false

question:
Assertion: Every polynomial of odd degree has at least one real zero.
Reason: Odd degree polynomials always cross the x-axis at some point.

options.c: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
options.b: Both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
options.d: Assertion is true but reason is false
options.a: Both assertion and reason are false

question:
Assertion: The remainder theorem can be used to find the value of a polynomial at any point.
Reason: When a polynomial p(x) is divided by (x - a), the remainder is equal to p(a).

options.b: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
options.a: Both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
options.d: Assertion is true but reason is false
options.c: Both assertion and reason are false
